author: A_Brickset_user
title: Look at the Windshield!
review: This one was one of the most wonderful sets ever... perhaps because I think it was the first model I ever owned.  The only thing I remember, though, is that my cousin came home and took it apart.  Years later my dad bought it again and it remains mostly in one piece.  I love how with simple pieces Lego would come up with the most wonderful designs.  No need for an exotic piece for the windshield...

author: A_Brickset_user
title: A beautiful red lego set!
review:
Normally I hate lego sets which are mostly red, but this set is amazing! I love the yellow tubes, the yellow "space guns!", and especially the flawless design of the helicopter.  Plus all those pieces are nice and versatile for making alternative models too. 

One of these days I'm going to make a fleet of helicopters just like this one!

author: hustla187
title: The Old Fire Copter
review: This is a pretty wicked copter Lego made back in 1982. I like the windshield and the hoses on each side of the copter. It is a classic example of a good Lego helicopter from the front to the back. 5 out of 5.

author: villicus
title: the classic copter
review: In my opinion, this one is the best helicopter lego did for the city theme. Comes very detailed, the design is awesome and i was proud to get it. Years later, i had to rebuy it and it still hasnt loosen its charme.

author: SimonStickfish
title: Lovely model of fire copter
review: This model brings back a lot of good memories. It wasn't me that got it, but it was my brother's. I believe he got it from my grandparents. It is just so cute and adorable, I saw it a few years ago, flying above a wooden (not-lego) castle. Of course it wasn't flying, but it was hanging on a fish wire or something ;-). I agree with others commenting that it was a really good set for the town's flying forces!

author: clundsberg
title: Very First Set Ever (that came with the lego guy)!
review:
I remember my Danish relatives visiting us in the states and they gave this to me as a gift.  Now I had had lego sets before: the uber vintage Scooter, Biplane, Learjet, etc...but this was my first taste of a set that came with a tiny smiley-faced lego guy.  Nothing can get this dude down!  But who can blame him?  He gets to fly around in a sweet chopper, blasting away fires and he came with cool ax n walkie-talkie accessories!
The instructions are tattered n torn, the set dismantled and I'm more than certain a few parts are missing. I still recognize my firefighter as my first glimpse into a fun new world of toys (and I see this in my son now too) so perhaps I shall hunt down a few missing pieces and reconstruct this most excellent set.  I still have the pieces with the stickers, so its a good start.

author: city_transport_rox
title: Didn't even know I had it until now!
review: Today i have reviewed many of the older LEGO sets. Then I found out that I had some interesting parts such as a helicopter propeller, an upside-down windscreen an axe, radio and some unusual yellow pieces. I decide to look up older helicopters and find this. It comes with 1 minifig in a helicopter with fire-fighting equipment. Although it is a little tight in the helicopter, the minifig still fits quite well. I have every piece exept the back propeller. Overall a great set to help fight fires in your town.
